ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Breakdown_node_relationship is a relationship between an alternative solution or a definition of a breakdown element and a definition of a breakdown element.
The instance of an entity type listed in complex_product_select type that is related.
The instance of an entity type listed in breakdown_element_select type that is related.
A text that provides further information about the relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
If the relation_type is 'functionality' or 'realization', the related and relating shall be of different types.
If the relation_type is 'decomposition', 'specialization' or 'occurrence', the related and relating shall be of same type or types where one is a subtype of the other.
If the relation_type is 'occurrence', the relating shall be a Physical_element_definition
A Complex_node_relationship is a relationship between two instances of the same kind of entities listed in complex_product_select type.
The first instance of an entity type listed in complex_product_select type that is related.
The second instance of an entity type listed in complex_product_select type that is related.

The text that specifies the meaning of the relationship.
Where applicable, the following values shall be used:
'derivation': the related complex_product_select is derived from the relating complex_product_select. The relationship does not imply inheritance of any kind between the application objects that are related.
'replacement': the related complex_product_select is used in place of the relating complex_product_select.
'version hierarchy': the related complex_product_select is a sub version of the relating complex_product_select.
'version hierarchy' is used, whenever a revision of one particular version is prepared, for example 'version 1.1'.
'version sequence': the relating complex_product_select is the preceding version and the related complex_product_select is the following version. The relationship does not imply inheritance of any kind between the application objects that are related.
'version sequence' is used, whenever a new version is prepared, for example 'version 1.0' is the preceding version of 'version 2.0'.
A text that provides further information about the relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
The type of the relating shall either be the same or a specialization of the type of the related, or, the type of the related shall either be the same or a specialization of the type of the relating.

A Class_breakdown_association is an association of a Product_class with a breakdown element. A Class_breakdown_association may associate a Product_class with the top node of a generic decomposition of products of that product class.
The Product_class that is considered.
The Functional_element_definition or the Physical_element_definition that is associated.

The text that specifies the meaning of the association.
Where applicable, the following values shall be used:
'functionality': The related functional element is an element of the functional structure of the relating Product_class. This relation type shall only be used if the related object is a Functional_element_definition;
'realization': The related physical element fulfils, partially or fully, the requirements identified with the relating Product_class. This relation type shall only be used if the related object is a Physical_element_definition.
A text that provides further information about the association. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Design_constraint_context_association is the association of a design constraint with the context where this constraint is valid. A design constraint about ergonomy of driving devices may be specified in the context of the design of a new product class of cars.
The Design_constraint_definition that is considered.
The Product_class for which the design constraint shall be considered.

A Design_constraint_definition is a type of Product_view_definition that specifies a definition of a version of requirement that impacts the design of some physical or functional elements. In the present context, design of a functional or physical element means design of parts that realize or fulfills the functional or organic requirement. Ergonomic information like 'hip point' or 'forward driver vision' as well as 'door opening control lines', 'shipping critical dimensions', or 'stone throw zone' are examples of design constraint.
The standard diameter of soft drink cans is a constraint for designing the hole of a cup holder in a car.
The Requirement_version, the Design_constraint_definition is a definition of.
A Design_constraint_association is an associatio between a design constraint and a breakdown element or alternative solution whose design is impacted by the design constraint.
The instance of an entity type listed in complex_product_select type, whose design is constrained by the associated design constraint.
The Design_constraint_definition that is associated.
A text by which the association may be referred to. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Design_constraint_relationship is a type of View_definition_relationship that relates two design constraints.
Where applicable, the inherited relation_type attribute shall take the following values:
'decomposition': the related Design_constraint_definition is a component of the relating Design_constraint_definition;
'precedence': the related Design_constraint_definition has higher priority than the relating Design_constraint_definition.
the first design constraint that is related.
the second design constraint that is related.

A Part_function_association is a type of View_definition_relationship that relates a functional element with a definition of a version of a part that realizes this functionality.
Where applicable, the inherited relation_type attribute shall take the following values:
'realization': the Functional_element_definition identifies the primary function of the part;
'additional functionality': the Functional_element_definition identifies an additional function of the part represented with the Part_view_definition. This Part_view_definition shall also be referred to by a Part_function_association with association_type 'realization'.
The Functional_element_definition that specifies a definition of the realized functionality.
The Part_view_definition that identifies the definition of the part the provides the functionality.

A Part_occurrence_relationship is a type of View_definition_relationship that relates two part occurrences.
Where applicable, the inherited relation_type attribute shall take the following values:
'usage replacement': this value shall characterize instances of Replaced_usage_relationship;
'same time machining': both part occurrences result from the same manufacturing operation.
the first part occurrence that is related.
the second part occurrence that is related.

A Replaced_usage_relationship is a type of Part_occurrence_relationship that specifies that the part occurrence referred to as relating_view is replaced by the part occurrence identified as related_view.
This replacement is specified in the context of a part collection or of an alternative solution. Both part occurrences shall be elements of this part collection or of this alternative solution.
Each Replaced_usage_relationship shall be referenced by an Effectivity_assignment that defines the validity of the replacement.
The instance of Collected_item_association or of Solution_element that identifies a context in which the relating part occurrence is considered and where the replacement applies.
In this specialization of Part_occurrence_relationship, the relation_type is assigned the value 'usage replacement'.

A Specification_category_breakdown_influence is an association with a specification category the members of which influence, in the context of a particular Product_class, the design of the solutions and parts realizing a breakdown element. For cars, the specification category containing the target markets, influences the design of the realization of the function Driving, as the driving side may vary.
The Class_category_association that identifies the influencing Specification_category and the Product_class in which this influence is considered.
The instance of an entity listed in breakdown_element_select, the design of the solutions of which is influenced.
The agg1_in_agg2 function evaluates if the agg1 aggregate is included in the agg2 aggregate.
The aggregate whose inclusion in the agg2 aggregate is evaluated.
The aggregate that may or not contain agg1.
